intro: Eschscholzia tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, papery petals that range in color from pale yellow to red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies.
